page.title: 06FARMING..MACHINERY/ANIMALS
page.content: Pitbladdo is a capital-intensive farm -they own 3 combine harvesters, which operate from dawn to midnight during the harvest seasons; 8 tractors, a potato picking machine and many other smaller machines and implements. The increase in mechanisation has meant a corresponding fall in the amount of labour employed on the farm. The farm no longer keeps any animals. At one time, in addition to the dairy herds and horses they kept hens for eggs but have never eaten any of the animals they reared. They do however grow their own vegetables in the farmhouse garden. One recent improvement to the farm was the installation of plastic drains to a boggy area of land. This was funded by a 37% to 50% grant from the EEC, which the Stewarts say is the only benefit they have received.
